description: Comprehensive testing plan for all 8 inventory tools (inventory_manifest, dependency_inventory, api_inventory, database_inventory, config_inventory, test_inventory, documentation_inventory) to verify correct functionality, output accuracy, security hardening, performance, and error handling.
goal: Verify that all 8 inventory tools work correctly across various project scenarios and generate accurate, secure manifests before v2.0.0 production deployment.
requirements: Test against active project in external environment (not docs-mcp)
Verify all aspects: functionality, correctness, security, performance, error handling
Generate comprehensive test results and validation reports
Ensure manifests are accurate and contain expected data structure
Verify security features (sensitive value masking, path validation)
Measure performance (tools complete within acceptable time)
Test error handling for edge cases and malformed inputs
out_of_scope: Automated CI/CD test suite creation (manual testing only)
Unit-level testing of individual generator classes
Documentation of test procedures (focus on execution, not documentation)
Load testing with extremely large projects (10K+ files)
constraints: External project must be available and accessible
Testing must work across different tech stacks (Python, Node.js, etc.)
Must preserve external project integrity (no modifications)
Must work with docs-mcp v2.0.0 current implementation
Results must be saved to testing directory for review

testing_scope.tools_to_test: All 8 (manifest, dependency, api, database, config, test, documentation)
test_areas: Basic functionality - tools execute without errors
Output correctness - manifests have correct data
Security - sensitive values masked, path traversal prevented
Performance - tools complete in acceptable time
Error handling - graceful failures on malformed input

deliverables: Test execution log with all 8 tools tested
Sample manifests from each tool (inventory.json, dependencies.json, api.json, database.json, config.json, tests.json, documentation.json)
Security validation report (sensitive values properly masked)
